tif

Class DirectoryIFD

  • java.lang.Object
    • tif.DirectoryIFD
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Directory<DirectoryIFD.EntryIFD>, java.lang.Iterable<DirectoryIFD.EntryIFD>

    public class DirectoryIFD
extends java.lang.Object
implements Directory<DirectoryIFD.EntryIFD>
    A collection-based representation of a TIFF Image File Directory (IFD).

    A DirectoryIFD2 serves as a specialised container for DirectoryIFD.EntryIFD objects. It provides a high-level API to retrieve metadata in native Java formats, such as Date, String, or RationalNumber, while handling the underlying TIFF type conversions automatically.

    Each instance represents a single directory within the file. While some directories contain pixel data, others may store only metadata structures, such as EXIF or GPS blocks.

    Since:
    13 August 2025
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Trevor Maggs
    See Also:
    DirectoryIFD.EntryIFD

      • getTagEntry

        public DirectoryIFD.EntryIFD getTagEntry(Taggable tag)
        Retrieves the EntryIFD associated with the specified tag.

        This method provides access to the raw directory entry, including its type, count, and offset/value data.

        Parameters:
        tag - the enumeration tag to look for
        Returns:
        the matched EntryIFD resource, or null if the tag is not present in this directory

      • getRawByteArray

        public byte[] getRawByteArray(Taggable tag)
        Returns a copy of the raw bytes associated with a tag.

        Use this method for tags containing "black box" data, such as embedded XMP packets, ICC profiles, or private maker notes.

        Parameters:
        tag - the tag to obtain raw bytes for
        Returns:
        a raw byte array, or an empty array if the tag is missing

        Parameters:
        tag - the tag to check
        Returns:
        true if the tag exists and is convertible without loss of precision, otherwise false

      • getIntValue

        public int getIntValue(Taggable tag)
        Returns the integer value associated with the specified tag.

        If the tag is missing or if the entry is not convertible to an int, this method throws an exception, since numeric values are considered required when calling this method.

        Parameters:
        tag - the enumeration tag to retrieve
        Returns:
        the tag's value as an int
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the tag is missing or the entry's value is not convertible (i.e. unsigned LONG or RATIONAL) to a Java 32-bit int safely and losslessly
